element.name: xsl:apply-imports
element.description: The <xsl:template> element is used to build templates.

element.name: xsl:apply-templates
element.description: The <xsl:apply-templates> element applies a template to the current element or to the current element's child nodes.

element.name: xsl:attribute
element.description: The <xsl:attribute> element is used to add attributes to elements.

element.name: xsl:attribute-set
element.description: The <xsl:attribute-set> element creates a named set of attributes. The attribute-set can be applied as whole to the output document.

element.name: xsl:call-template
element.description: The <xsl:call-template> element calls a named template.

element.name: xsl:comment
element.description: The <xsl:comment> element is used to create a comment node in the result tree.

element.name: xsl:copy
element.description: The <xsl:copy> element creates a copy of the current node.

element.name: xsl:copy-of
element.description: The <xsl:copy-of> element creates a copy of the current node.

element.name: xsl:decimal-format
element.description: The <xsl:decimal-format> element defines the characters and symbols to be used when converting numbers into strings, with the format-number() function.

element.name: xsl:import
element.description: The <xsl:import> element is a top-level element that is used to import the contents of one style sheet into another.

element.name: xsl:include
element.description: The <xsl:include> element is a top-level element that includes the contents of one style sheet into another.

element.name: xsl:key
element.description: The <xsl:key> element is a top-level element which declares a named key that can be used in the style sheet with the key() function.

element.name: xsl:message
element.description: The <xsl:message> element writes a message to the output. This element is primarily used to report errors.

element.name: xsl:text
element.description: The <xsl:text> element is used to write literal text to the output.

element.name: xsl:number
element.description: The <xsl:number> element is used to determine the integer position of the current node in the source. It is also used to format a number.

element.name: xsl:when
element.description: The <xsl:when> element is used to specify an action for the <xsl:choose> element. The <xsl:when> element evaluates an expression, and if it returns true, an action is performed.
